data.question: What is the highest coordination number known for europium in the context of the text?
What type of ligands are coordinated by nitrogen atoms in the rare-earth MOFs mentioned?
data.answer: Five-membered aromatic nitrogen heterocycles 1,2,4-triazole or imidazole

data.question: What is the role of mercury in the synthesis of 1[Eu(Tzpy)2]?
Why is the solvothermal synthesis in pyridine more favorable for producing 1[Eu(Tzpy)2]?
data.answer: Because without pyridine, the reaction requires a higher temperature and results in only a powder form of 1[Eu(Tzpy)2], and any slight overheating leads to decomposition of the ligand.

data.question: What is the coordination environment of Eu3 in 1[Eu(Tzpy)2]?
What does the presence of a weak signal at d = 0.8 mm s-1 in 151Eu MDßbauer spectroscopy indicate?
True or False: The icosahedral coordination has been previously reported for coordination polymers and frameworks.
True or False: All europium sites in 1[Eu(Tzpy)2] contain EuIII.
What is the result of introducing an additional nitrogen atom into the benzotriazole ligand for 1[Eu(Tzpy)2]?
data.answer: It enables 1,3-chelate bonding, allowing multidimensional connectivity.

data.question: True or False: The Eu-N distances in the icosahedron of 1[Eu(Tzpy)2] significantly exceed the expected values for LaIII and PrIII.
What is the yield of 1[Eu(Tzpy)2] when synthesized as described in the text?
True or False: The crystal structure of 1[Eu(Tzpy)2] contains only one type of europium site.
What is the effect of the backbone of CH groups from the benzotriazole ligands?
data.answer: It prevents higher-dimensional connectivity in the system.

data.question: True or False: The reaction to synthesize 1[Eu(Tzpy)2] without pyridine requires a lower temperature than with pyridine.
What is the coordination number of Eu2 and Eu1 in the crystal structure of 1[Eu(Tzpy)2]?
data.answer: Eu2 is eightfold coordinated and Eu1 is ninefold coordinated

data.question: True or False: The Eu-N distances for CN = 12 (Eu3) in the icosahedron are shorter than for CN = 8 (Eu2) and CN = 9 (Eu1).
What is the main signal detected in 151Eu MDßbauer spectroscopy for 1[Eu(Tzpy)2]?
data.answer: A main signal at d = -12.9 mm s-1, corresponding to EuII

data.question: True or False: The synthesis of 1[Eu(Tzpy)2] results in a compound that is air- and moisture-sensitive.
What is the purpose of heating the reaction mixture to 190 8C over 100 h in the synthesis of 1[Eu(Tzpy)2]?
data.answer: To ensure that pyridine is under solvothermal conditions

data.question: What is the crystal system of 1[Eu(Tzpy)2]?
